review_blob: The beautifully subtle floral aromas dont linger ling enough to fool the palate into expecting a flavor that matches the nose.  The flavor is fairly bland but has a nice light effervescence and a semi sweet after taste.  Not bad, not my fave.
A near perfect IRS, especially good when poured on nitrogen.  Exceptional palate and strong notes of roasted coffee, dark chocolate and some orange peel.  AMAZING
beer_name: North Coast Old Rasputin Russian Imperial Stout

beer_brewer_name: Port Brewing Co / The Lost Abbey
review_blob: Delicious IPA.  doesnt quite stack up with Hop 15 or Mongo but for a single IPA, you cant go wrong with this one.

Very solid brown ale.  Its hard to give any brown ale a super high score, but this one really delivers what you want in an easy drinking session ale.
Not too chocolate heavy, not too bubbly.  I think this is a british style brown as opposed to the sweeter American style version.
beer_name: Golden Road Get Up Offa That Brown

review_blob: Nice play on Golden Roads Gettup Offa That Brown.  Had it at Blue Palms, and really enjoyed how delicately the bourbon essence mixed with the brown ale.  I hope they make it again, but ive been told it was a one off.

I was disappointed that at the brewery they dont pour it with a big thick head like they do in Germany.  I pour it thick out of the can and let the aromas emanate.
I actually like it better from the can than from the tap, but Im not sure if that was just my mood or the product.  More research will be needed in this area.
Unfiltered and beautifully so, the Hefe delivers in every way that a Hefe ought to.
Great big flavors of wheat, and spice with hints of citrus and banana.  Nice light moutfeel that lets you knock em back and a great citrusy finish.
Great beer

Im not a pilsner drinker.  There, I said it.

Well, actually, I wasnt a pilsner drinker until I found this beer.  I was reluctant to try it but now that I did, Im hooked.

Hoppy and light grain aromas give a hint of whats to come.  Teasing flavors of hops drive this beer in a surprising way.

Drinkable, enjoyable, perfect.

beer_brewer_name: Port Brewing Co / The Lost Abbey
review_blob:
This beer is a mouthful.  A real mouthful, and only in the best way.
Picked up a bottle at Whole Foods and served it at about 45 degrees, which was recommended by JBVFR and I must say a great recommendation.

Pours thick black and provides a significant roast and fruit aroma that is perfectly in line with the flavors.
My favorite part of this beer is the mouthfeel.  Heavy, syrupy and seductive, its a real treat.

A great beer to share with some friends (comes in a 750) and enjoy slowly with contemplation.

I drank this at the brewery with 3 others.  All of us are beer nerds and we had a mixed reaction to the beer.

I absolutely love it, but its subtle and you have to go in with an open mind.  Layers upon layers of flavors and aromas make this a wonderful beer to drink slowly and savor.  

This is more like a classic drama and less like an action film.  One member of my group didnt care for it much and let me finish his, though I had to fight for it because my girlfriend fell in love with it.  He claimed it was without any distinctive flavor, a claim 3 of us dispute.  The fourth member of the group claimed that the graininess of the wheat was overpowering the subtle tequila essence and that it should have spent more time in the barrel.

My palate might nit be as developed as his, but I know one thing for sure.  This is a delightful beer chalk full of surprises and lingering subtleties.

I was still thinking about it this morning.  Just might have to go back for another one today.

Point The Way has the taste, smell, look and mouthfeel consistent with top shelf California IPAs like Union Jack 7.5%, Torpedo 7%, Alesmith IPA 7%, Sculpin 7% etc  At 5.2% Point The way delivers on the promise of a satisfying hoppy beer with a lot less booze.
beer_name: Golden Road Point the Way IPA

review_blob: Too bad it doesnt taste as good as it looks and smells.  Great citrusy nose with nothing really to back it up.  Not an offensive beer but not worth seeking out either
Inversion is NOT a true west coast IPA.  It doesnt present that intense Hoppiness that IPAs around here need to have.  I found this beer to be decent but a disappointment from Deschutes.

A perfect California IPA.  Huge grapefruit hoppiness.  
Racer 5 is quickly becoming the go to IPA in bars and restaurants around LA.  That is a very good thing.

Very surprising beer.  Its a rauch beer from nose to finish, but highlighted by an incredibly available hopiness throughout the drinking and finish.
Smoke and hops have never been so nicely married.
Hoppy enough to be respected and admired on the west coast.  This is a fantastic exhibition of hops and good from sight to finish.  Among the best IPAs in the world

How can anyone not love Sculpin.  It is the quintessential California IPA.  At 7% it presents everything you want in an IPA, hop driven throughout, enough maltiness to supports the piney and citrussy nose and palate.
Beautiful
